question: If the static pipe becomes party blocked?

choices.choice: The VSI indication will be too high when descending.
The VSI indication will be too high when accelerating.
The VSI indication will be too low when climbing or descending.
The VSI indication will be unaffected.

subject: Instruments

question: If the choke in the VSI becomes partly blocked?

choices.choice: The VSI Indication will be too high when climbing.
The VSI Indication will be too low when descending.
The VSI Indication will be too high at all times.
The VSI Indication will be too high when climbing or descending.

subject: Instruments

question: The correct action to be taken when the static vent blocks on an unpressurised aircraft is to?

choices.choice: Open a window to equailse pressures.

subject: Instruments

question: If the casing of a VSI in a pressurised aircraft develops a leak?

choices.choice: VSI Indication will be too low when climbing or descending.
VSI Indication will be too high when climbing or descening.
VSI Indication will be too low when climbing and too high when descending.
VSI Indication will be too high when climbing and too low when descending.

subject: Instruments

choices.choice: Produces an output proportional to amblent pressure.
Measures the difference between total pressure and static pressure.
Measures the difference between the pressure Inside and outside a capsule.

question: A VSI Indicates increasing ROD by?

choices.choice: The VSI indicates only vertical speeds not acceleration.

subject: Instruments

question: As an aircraft moves close to the ground during a landing the VSI might?

choices.choice: Become Inaccurate due to ground effect.
Stick due to loss of pilot source.
Become Inaccurate due to aircraft attitude change.
